title: Service Document
description: The Service Document defines the capabilities and operational parameters of the server as a whole, or of a particular Service-URL.

@context.title: The JSON-LD Context for this document

@id.title: The URL of the service document you are looking at

@type.title: JSON-LD identifier for the document type
@type.description: This field is used to define the type of the document, and in this case should always be 'ServiceDocument'.  MUST be present.

dc:title.title: The title or name of the Service

root.title: The URL for the root Service Document.

acceptDeposits.title: Does the Service accept deposits?
acceptDeposits.description: SHOULD be present.  If omitted, the client MUST assume that the service does not accept deposits.

version.title: The version of the SWORD protocol this server supports

maxUploadSize.title: Maximum size in kB as an integer for files being uploaded.
maxUploadSize.description: SHOULD be present.  If omitted, the client MUST assume the server will accept an upload of any size.

maxByReferenceSize.title: Maximum size in kB as an integer for files uploaded by reference.
maxByReferenceSize.description: SHOULD be present.  If omitted, the client MUST assume the server will accept a file of any size.

accept.title: List of Content Types which are acceptable to the server.
accept.description: MUST be present.  '*/*' for any content type, or a list of acceptable content types

acceptPackaging.title: List of Packaging Formats which are acceptable to the server.
acceptPackaging.description: SHOULD be present.  '*' for any packaging format, or a list of acceptable packaging formats.  Acceptable packaging formats SHOULD be an IRI for a known format.  If this is omitted, the client MUST assume the server only supports the 3 required SWORD packaging formats (see the section Packaging Formats)

acceptMetadata.title: List of Metadata Formats which are acceptable to the server.
acceptMetadata.description: SHOULD be present.  '*' for any metadata format, or a list of acceptable metadata formats.  Acceptable metadata formats SHOULD be an IRI for a known format.  If this is omitted, the client MUST assume the server only supports the standard SWORD metadata format: http://purl.org/net/sword/3.0/types/Metadata

collectionPolicy.title: URL and description of the serverâ€™s collection policy.

treatment.title: URL and description of the treatment content can expect during deposit.

byReferenceDeposit.title: Does the server support By-Reference deposit?
byReferenceDeposit.description: SHOULD be present.   If omitted, the client MUST assume the server does not support By-Reference deposit.

segmentedUpload.title: Does the server support Segmented Upload?
segmentedUpload.description: SHOULD be present.  If omitted, the client MUST assume the server does not support Segmented Upload.

unfinishedSegmentRetention.title: What is the minimum time a server will hold on to an incomplete Segmented Upload before deleting it.
unfinishedSegmentRetention.description: SHOULD be present.  If omitted, the client MUST assume that the server will hold on to the incomplete file indefinitely.  Servers MAY delete the unfinished upload at any time after the minimum time stated here has elapsed.

onBehalfOf.title: Does the server support deposit on behalf of other users (mediation)
onBehalfOf.description: SHOULD be present.  If omitted, the client MUST assume the server does not support On-Behalf-Of deposit.

concurrencyControl.title: Does the server enforce concurrency control?
concurrencyControl.description: SHOULD be present.  If concurrency control is enforced, the client MUST take note of the ETag and use the If-Match header in relevant requests. If omitted, the client MUST assume the server does not support Concurrency Control.

digest.title: The list of digest formats that the server will accept.
digest.description: MUST be present, and MUST include SHA-256, MAY include any others.

authentication.title: List of authentication schemes supported by the server.
authentication.description: SHOULD be present.  If not provided the client MUST assume the server does not support authentication.

services.title: List of Services contained within the parent service
